questions.question: Persons who maintain medical gas systems shall be qualified to perform maintenance operations with qualifications demonstrated by____________.
options: training and certification through the healthcare facility

questions.question: Scheduled maintenance for equipment and procedures shall be established through the __________________ of the facility.
Oxygen and medical air outlets serving critical care areas shall allow a transient flow rate of _________.
___________ shall not be introduced into the medical vacuum or WAGD system for disposal.
Central supply systems for nonflammable medical gases shall be inspected _______________.
A(n) ______________ review of bulk system capacity shall be conducted to ensure the source system has sufficient capacity.
Carbon monoxide monitors shall be calibrated at least ____________.
Medical vacuum station inlet terminal performance shall be tested _______________________.
options: on a regular preventative maintenance schedule

questions.question: Medical vacuum inlets shall draw__________SCFM, without reducing the vacuum pressure below _______ at any adjacent station inlet.
Medical vacuum station inlet terminal performance shall be tested based on a flow of ___________ into a station inlet while __________ checking the vacuum level.

Non-stationary manufactured assemblies which employ flexible connections between the user terminal and the piping system shall be tested for leaks per the manufacturer's recommendation, or every _____ months.
Area alarms shall be tested to verify the warning signals for all vital life support and critical care areas if the pressure in the piping system increases or decreases by_______.
All gas outlets with a gauge pressure of 50 PSI shall deliver______SCFM with a pressure drop of not more than______PSI and static pressure of 50-55 PSI.
Medical air purity for compressor systems shall be analyzed prior to the source valve being opened. Samples taken at the system sample port for carbon monoxide shall not exceed _________.
Support gas outlets shall deliver______SCFM with a pressure drop of not more than 5 PSI gauge and static pressure of_________PSI.
Nitrogen and instrument air supply systems are not to be used for patient care, but are used for powering pneumatic devices and should be considered _________ gases.
Labels for shut-off valves shall be updated________________________.
The ___________________ shall be responsible for developing and enforcing the permit-to-work rules for the piped medical gas and vacuum systems.
The person(s) designated as the Responsible Facility Authority shall be _________ to interpret, implement and advise on this Code.
The Responsible Facility Authority must be qualified to ASSE 6010, 6020, 6030 or 6040 and must be _________________ on the specific equipment and design of that facility.

summary.note: total_time_used_seconds will update dynamically as questions are attempted.
